channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Jayshree Ullal: The Indian-origin billionaire who is worth more than Sundar Pichai and Satya Nadella
From Air India crash to Zohran Mamdani, the A to Z of 2025
Trump and Zelenskyy meet in Florida. Is the Russia-Ukraine war ending soon?
History Today: When Ghislaine Maxwell was convicted in Epstein case
FirstUp: Israeli PM Netanyahu to meet Trump and other headlines of the day
Not kidding around: How laughing could be the best medicine
How Abraham pact with Somaliland is Netanyahu’s new masterstroke
item.description: The collaboration with Somaliland will allow Israel to have a military base at the strategically important ports of Berbera and Bosaso, opposite Yemen, as well as in the Horn of Africa, ceding Tel Aviv a unique strategic advantage

item.title: How AI is making the nuclear arms race 2.0 even more disruptive
item.description: The old mechanisms to prevent the spread of nuclear weapons are too antiquated and have lost their meaning with the coming of artificial intelligence into the nuclear arms race

item.title: Why Indian Navy must safeguard Oman’s maritime interests
item.description: India’s role becomes increasingly important as the United States retrenches for economic and ideological reasons, while China’s assertiveness intensifies in the region

item.title: From Colombo to Dhaka: The political economy of unrest in India’s backyard
item.description: The region does not present a single-cause story, but an underlying sequence is recognisable. Macroeconomic stress squeezes household budgets; large, online and often underemployed youth cohorts convert frustration into organised action

item.title: Heritage escapes near Delhi to beat New Year’s rush
item.description: With the New Year around the corner, here are some offbeat heritage options that offer not just a low AQI, but also peace and solace

item.title: How Imec is a grand vision in a fragile geopolitics
item.description: The India-Middle East-Europe Economic Corridor tests India’s balancing act in West Asia. Translating the diplomatic capital into a functional economic corridor will require deft navigation, strategic patience, and a refusal to be distracted by transient geopolitical noise
